title: Barsoom Series
description: THE COLLECTED BARSOOM SERIES features seven novels set on Mars, or 'Barsoom' as its inhabitants call it. A PRINCESS OF MARS and its sequels follow the adventures of ex-Confederate soldier John Carter, who is inexplicably transported from Arizona Territory to the Martian surface. There he finds alien life, adventure in plenty, and the love of a Martian princess. This collection also includes the Burroughs classic THE PIRATES OF VENUS, from a similar series of works set on a wet and warm Venus.• A Princess of Mars• The Gods of Mars• Warlord of Mars• Thuvia, Maid of Mars• The Chessmen of Mars• The Mastermind of Mars• A Fighting Man of MarsBonus Novel• Pirates of VenusEdgar Rice Burroughs (1875-1950) was a prolific American novelist and pulp writer. Born in Chicago, Burroughs attended local schools and briefly served in the U.S. Cavalry in the 1890s before being discharged for health reasons. He soon returned to Chicago where he married and began writing after noting the poor quality of much of the pulp literature popular at the time. In a career spanning more than forty years, Burroughs produced some of the most memorable characters in popular literature including Tarzan, John Carter, and many others.
author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
